dmca.title: Honda Trade Dress Complaint
dmca.body:
Honda does not object to the signage shown in the 5 images that were
attached to your 7-9-07 email, with one exception.  Honda objects to use of
the phrase "Honda & Acura Specialist" and "Honda & Acura Automobile
Specialist" as shown in cody.004 and cody.005.  In view of your willingness
to address Honda's concerns and the relatively non-prominent position of the
signs on your premises, Honda will waive its objection if you will agree to
forbear from use of that phrase on any future signs or advertising and to
forbear from relocating the signs to position them to become more prominent.
Please let me know if that proposal is unacceptable to you.

To the extent that you show a graphic image or photograph of a Honda
automobile in your advertising, you are violating Honda's trade dress
rights.  Below is an excerpt from the demand letter that our office sends
when a company is using an image of a Honda automobile in its advertising
without Honda's authorization:
 

The image or appearance of a product is referred to as its "trade dress."
The distinctive shapes or images of Honda's automobiles are Honda's trade
dress and are protected by the trademark laws just the same as Honda's brand
names and design trademarks or logos are protected.  The shape or image of
Honda's automobiles cannot be copied or used in any form (including
photographs, drawings, or caricatures) without Honda's written
authorization.  See, e.g., American Honda Motor Co., Inc. v. Pro-Line
Protoform, 352 F.Supp.2d 1081, 1082 (C.D. Cal. 2004) (entering injunction
prohibiting defendant from selling model cars in form of Honda automobiles
and finding "distinctive shapes of Honda's vehicles, including in particular
the distinctive design and shape of Honda's Honda Civic, Honda Accord, and
Acura RSX automobiles, are immediately identifiable and associated by the
general public with Honda");  Volkswagenwerk, AG v. Smith, 471 F. Supp. 385
(D. N.M. 1979) (holding defendant service shop's reproduction of Volkswagen
silhouette on business advertisements infringes Volkswagen's trade dress and
constitutes unfair competition); Volkswagenwerk Aktiengesellschaft v.
Rickard, 492 F.2d 474 (5th Cir. 1974) (affirming injunction barring, among
other things, defendant service shop's use of "any silhouette, picture,
caricature, or reproduction of the shape or appearance of the Volkswagen
sedan"); Liquid Glass Enters. v. Dr. Ing, h.c.F. Porsche A.G., 8 F.Supp. 2d
398 (D. N.J. 1998) (entering preliminary injunction barring automobile
polish manufacturer from using or depicting Porsche 911 in its
advertisements).

I view the image on the website as a relatively small matter, and am hoping
that removing it will not cause you any serious inconvenience.  Since the
answering machine has been taken care of, I expect that Honda will close
this file once the image is down.
